intro: Schwalbea americana var. australis, commonly known as the Australian schwalbea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats.
